info.title: Torrust-Actix Tracker API
info.description:
This Swagger documentation page provides documentation and testing capabilities for the Torrust-Actix BitTorrent Tracker API service. Use this page to test and explore how the API responds to requests, which can be integrated into your website or application.

## Authentication
Most endpoints require authentication via a token query parameter. Configure your API token in the 'Authorize' section.

## Common Patterns
- All hashes (info_hash, key_hash, user_hash) are 40-character hexadecimal strings (SHA1)
- Bulk operations use request bodies with JSON arrays or objects
- Success responses typically include `{"status": "ok"}`

get.description: Returns tracker statistics in Prometheus text format for monitoring integration.

text/plain.example:
# HELP torrust_actix_torrents_total Total number of tracked torrents
# TYPE torrust_actix_torrents_total gauge
torrust_actix_torrents_total 1523
# HELP torrust_actix_peers_total Total number of connected peers
# TYPE torrust_actix_peers_total gauge
torrust_actix_peers_total 4521

get.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific torrent including seeds, peers, and statistics.

post.description: Adds a new torrent to the tracker or updates an existing one.

304.description: Torrent already exists and was updated

delete.description: Removes a torrent from the tracker.

get.description: Retrieves data for multiple torrents. **Note:** If you receive an error about BODY not being allowed in GET requests, this is a Swagger limitation. Use cURL to test this endpoint.

requestBody.description: Array of info_hash values to retrieve

post.description: Adds or updates multiple torrents with their completed counts.

requestBody.description: Object mapping info_hash to completed count

delete.description: Removes multiple torrents from the tracker.

requestBody.description: Array of info_hash values to delete

get.description: Checks whether a specific info_hash is in the whitelist.

post.description: Adds an info_hash to the tracker whitelist.

delete.description: Removes an info_hash from the tracker whitelist.

get.description: Checks whitelist status for multiple info_hashes. **Note:** If you receive an error about BODY not being allowed in GET requests, this is a Swagger limitation. Use cURL to test this endpoint.

requestBody.description: Array of info_hash values to check

post.description: Adds multiple info_hashes to the tracker whitelist.

requestBody.description: Array of info_hash values to whitelist

delete.description: Removes multiple info_hashes from the tracker whitelist.

requestBody.description: Array of info_hash values to remove

get.description: Checks whether a specific info_hash is in the blacklist.

post.description: Adds an info_hash to the tracker blacklist. Blacklisted torrents will be rejected.

delete.description: Removes an info_hash from the tracker blacklist.

get.description: Checks blacklist status for multiple info_hashes. **Note:** If you receive an error about BODY not being allowed in GET requests, this is a Swagger limitation. Use cURL to test this endpoint.

requestBody.description: Array of info_hash values to check

post.description: Adds multiple info_hashes to the tracker blacklist.

requestBody.description: Array of info_hash values to blacklist

delete.description: Removes multiple info_hashes from the tracker blacklist.

requestBody.description: Array of info_hash values to remove

get.description: Retrieves information about an API key including its timeout value.

delete.description: Removes an API key from the tracker.

post.description: Creates a new API key or updates the timeout of an existing one.

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Timeout value in seconds (0 for permanent)

get.description: Retrieves information for multiple API keys. **Note:** If you receive an error about BODY not being allowed in GET requests, this is a Swagger limitation. Use cURL to test this endpoint.

requestBody.description: Array of key_hash values to retrieve

post.summary: Create or update multiple API keys
post.description: Creates or updates multiple API keys with their timeout values.

requestBody.description: Object mapping key_hash to timeout value

delete.description: Removes multiple API keys from the tracker.

requestBody.description: Array of key_hash values to delete

get.description: Retrieves detailed information about a user including their statistics and active torrents.

delete.description: Removes a user from the tracker.

post.description: Creates a new user or updates an existing user's data.

get.description: Retrieves data for multiple users. **Note:** If you receive an error about BODY not being allowed in GET requests, this is a Swagger limitation. Use cURL to test this endpoint.

requestBody.description: Array of user_hash values to retrieve

post.description: Creates or updates multiple users with their data.

requestBody.description: Array of user data arrays [id, key, uploaded, downloaded, completed, updated, active]

delete.description: Removes multiple users from the tracker.

requestBody.description: Array of user_hash values to delete

token_auth.name: token
token_auth.description: API authentication token. Pass as query parameter: ?token=your_token

KeyHashPath.name: keyhash
KeyHashPath.description: API key hash (40-character hexadecimal SHA1 hash)

UserHashPath.name: userhash
UserHashPath.description: User passkey hash (40-character hexadecimal SHA1 hash)

TorrentsPostBody.description: Object mapping info_hash to completed count

torrents_active.description: Active torrents with their last activity timestamps

items.description: [id, key, uploaded, downloaded, completed, updated, active]
